title: Augmented Reality-Based Mobile Physics Learning: Advanced High School Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational physics concepts (force, motion, energy, etc.) and basic smartphone operation skills
context.additional_context: Establishment of experimental environments using AR content and operation of an integrated LMS management system

learning_goals: Core physics concepts (Newton's laws of motion, waves, electromagnetism, etc.) can be explained through visual simulations in augmented reality environments
Virtual implementations of real-world physical phenomena (electromagnetic induction, optical refraction, etc.) can be analyzed using AR-based experimental tools, with subsequent report writing
AR simulation projects can be collaboratively designed and executed with team members on a cooperative learning platform, followed by the creation of presentation videos
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
